results.description: Combine rp_css_earnings (high user/alpha) with its impact projection to capture momentum in earnings-related news. Applied SUGGESTION1 (used 2 datafields). SUGGESTION2 not applied (no vector fields). SUGGESTION3 applied: ts_backfill on both fields since coverage=0.5. SUGGESTION4 applied: rp_css_earnings has high userCount/alphaCount. Confidence set to 0.75 due to strong adoption and intuitive link between earnings sentiment and short-term moves.
results.implementation: zscore( subtract( ts_zscore( ts_backfill(rp_css_earnings,5),10 ), ts_zscore( ts_backfill(rp_nip_earnings,5),10 ) ) )

results.description: Signal = business sentiment minus investor-impact projection (rp_css_business vs rp_nip_inverstor). SUGGESTION1 used. SUGGESTION2 not applied. SUGGESTION3 applied: backfill both. SUGGESTION4 applied: rp_css_business and rp_nip_inverstor have high userCount. Confidence 0.78 because divergence often precedes re-pricing.
results.implementation: zscore( subtract( ts_zscore( ts_backfill(rp_css_business,5),15 ), ts_zscore( ts_backfill(rp_nip_inverstor,5),15 ) ) )

results.description: Use nws18_ghc_lna (change in analyst recommendation) alone to capture abrupt analyst actions. SUGGESTION1 lightly applied (single field). SUGGESTION2 N/A. SUGGESTION3 applied: ts_backfill due to coverage. SUGGESTION4 applied: nws18_ghc_lna has high user/alpha count. Confidence 0.72 given historical predictive power of analyst changes.

Combine nws18_bam (M&A sentiment) and rp_ess_mna (event sentiment MNA) to detect takeover optimism. SUGGESTION1 used. SUGGESTION3 applied to both. SUGGESTION2 not applied. SUGGESTION4 applied selecting high alphaCount fields. Confidence 0.70; M&A moves can be noisy but offer idiosyncratic returns.
results.implementation: zscore( add( ts_zscore( ts_backfill(nws18_bam,5),10 ), ts_zscore( ts_backfill(rp_ess_mna,5),10 ) ) )

results.description: rp_css_revenue vs rp_nip_revenue difference to highlight sentiment vs projected impact on revenue. SUGGESTION1 used. SUGGESTION3 applied. SUGGESTION4 used high user counts. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Confidence 0.73 — revenue-related news tends to move prices.
results.implementation: zscore( subtract( ts_zscore( ts_backfill(rp_css_revenue,5),12 ), ts_zscore( ts_backfill(rp_nip_revenue,5),12 ) ) )

results.description: rp_css_inverstor (composite investor relations sentiment) short-term zscore momentum. SUGGESTION1 minimal (single field). SUGGESTION3 applied. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.68 as IR signals are meaningful but sometimes lag.

rp_css_ptg (price target sentiment) minus rp_nip_ratings (ratings impact projection). SUGGESTION1 used. SUGGESTION3 backfill both. SUGGESTION4 used rp_nip_ratings high usage. SUGGESTION2 not used. Confidence 0.66; price target chatter often precedes tweaks.
results.implementation: zscore( subtract( ts_zscore( ts_backfill(rp_css_ptg,5),10 ), ts_zscore( ts_backfill(rp_nip_ratings,5),10 ) ) )

results.description: rp_css_price short-term surge detection. SUGGESTION1 single-field. SUGGESTION3 applied. SUGGESTION4 used (good userCount). Confidence 0.67 — direct price-related news tends to correlate with returns.

rp_ess_partner event sentiment strong positive -> mean-reversion or momentum bet. SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION3 applied. SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence 0.64 — partner news impact moderate but actionable.

rp_ess_legal negative spikes tend to be priced in; use reversed zscore to short. SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION3 applied. SUGGESTION4 modest. Confidence 0.65 due to asymmetric downside on legal news.

Use ts_ir on backfilled rp_nip_earnings to capture stable info-to-noise in earnings-impact series. SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION3 applied. SUGGESTION4 used moderate-high userCount. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence 0.69 — IR identifies stable signals.
rp_ess_technical momentum using short-term ts_returns; SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.60 because technical news is noisy.
